availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Apprehension of Fugitives from Justice Papers, 1859-1862

body.p:
Louisville Ky Oct 6. 1861
To His Excellency the Governor of Kentucky

I have client by the name of Marshall Woodson a free man of Color who is bail for Robert Ellis a free man of Color who is under an Indictment in the Jefferson Circuit Court for felony Committed in this city he has forfeited his bail and is now believed to be in the State of Ohio

Woodson disires a requisition on the Governor of Ohio for Ellis I would be glad that you would issue one he wants to relieve himself of his bail bond. I enclose to you a copy of the Indict=
ment against Ellis. I would suggest James Lee a former police officer in this city as a suitable person to appoint to recieve him as Woodson has engaged him to do so.

Jefferson Cir. Ct
Felony
Robt Ellis (a free man of color)
Requisition Issd Octo 7. 1861
